document.docAuthor: Oliveira, Luiz Fernando M. & Brescovit, Antonio D.
document.docTitle: Xiruana pocone Oliveira & Brescovit, 2015, new species
document.masterDocTitle: A taxonomic revision of the Neotropical spider genus Xiruana Brescovit 1997 (Araneae: Anyphaenidae, Anyphaeninae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A taxonomic revision of the Neotropical spider genus Xiruana Brescovit 1997 (Araneae: Anyphaenidae, Anyphaeninae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Teudis lenis :
Mello-Leitão, 1941
: 203
(male,
MLP 15048
, examined, misidentification).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material
. Male holotype and female paratype from Porto Cercado (
16 ° 15 ' 25 "S
;
56 ° 37 ' 22 "W
), Poconé , Mato Grosso, Brazil ,
17–18 .II. 2010
, L.D. Battirola leg., deposited in IBSP 165991 and 165990 , respectively. Male and female paratypes from Parque Nacional Pilcomayo, Província Formosa , Buenos Aires: Argentina ,
XI. 1990
, M. Ramírez leg., deposited in MACN .
Etymology . The specific name is a noun in apposition taken from the type locality.

Diagnosis . Males of
Xiruana pocone
n . sp .
resembles those of
X. jaboticabal
n . sp .
by the palp with extremely long base of conductor of Anyphaeninae, distant from the ventral tegular process, but differs by the thin, small anterior branch of the retrolateral tibial apophysis, and conspicuous triangular median tibial apophysis (
Figs 6
D– F). Females resemble those of
X. tetraseta
by the shape of the epigynal plate, but differ by the narrower median septum and internally with shorter copulatory ducts and fertilization ducts superposed to the spermathecae (
Figs 6
G, H).

Description . Male ( IBSP 165991 ). Coloration as in
X. hirsuta
. Total length 7.6 , carapace length 3.2 , width 2.5 . Clypeus height 0.12 . Eye diameters and interdistances: AME 0.14 , ALE 0.14 , PME 0.14 , PLE 0.14 ; AME–AME 0.04 , AME–ALE 0.04 , PME–PME 0.16 , PME–PLE 0.14 , ALE–PLE 0.02 . Chelicerae 1.9 long, with four promarginal teeth and six retromarginal denticles. Leg measurements: Leg I—femur 4.0/ patella 1.5 / tibia 4.7 / metatarsus 4.4 / tarsus 1.8 / total 16.4 ; II— 3.5 / 1.4 / 3.9 / 3.6 / 1.5 / 13.9 ; III— 2.6 / 1.1 / 2.0/ 2.6 / 0.9 / 9.2 ; IV— 3.5 / 1.3 / 3.2 / 4.4 / 1.0/ 13.4 . Leg spination: I—tibia p 1 - 1 -0, r 1 -0-0, metatarsus p0, r0; II—tibia p 1 - 1 -0, r 1 -0-0, metatarsus
v 2 - 1
-0, p0, r0; III—tibia p 1 - 0-1 , r 1 - 0-1 ; IV—tibia p 1 - 1 - 1 , r 1 - 1 - 1 . Palp: posterior branch of the retrolateral tibial apophysis long and curved at apex, anterior branch slender (
Figs 6
D–F); median apophysis long and narrow (
Figs 6
A–C). Abdomen: length 4.2 , epigastric furrow 0.6 from tracheal spiracle, spiracle 2.4 from base of spinnerets.

Female ( IBSP 165990 ). Coloration as in male. Total length 9.0, carapace length 3.3 , width 2.6 . Clypeus height 0.08 . Eye diameters and interdistances: AME 0.14 , ALE 0.16 , PME 0.16 , PLE 0.16 ; AME–AME 0.04 , AME–ALE 0.02 , PME–PME 0.18 , PME–PLE 0.12 , ALE–PLE 0.04 . Chelicerae 1.5 long, with five promarginal teeth and six retromarginal denticles. Leg measurements: Leg I—femur 3.3 / patella 1.3 / tibia 3.6 / metatarsus 3.1 / tarsus 1.3 / total 12.6 ; II— 3.1 / 1.2 / 3.1 / 2.7 / 1.1 / 11.2 ; III— 2.4 / 1.0/ 1.9 / 2.4 / 0.8 / 8.5 ; IV— 3.4 / 1.3 / 2.9 / 3.9 / 1.0/ 12.5 . Leg spination: I—tibia
v 2 - 2
-0, p0, r0, metatarsus
v 2
-0-0, p0, r0; II—tibia
v 2 - 2
-0, p 1 - 1 -0, r0, metatarsus
v 2
-0-0, p0, r0; IV—tibia p 1 - 1 - 1 , r 1 - 1 - 1 . Abdomen: length 5.7 , epigastric furrow 0.8 from tracheal spiracle, spiracle 3.4 from base of spinnerets. Epigynum: epigynal plate with posterior border wider than anterior border; internally, seminal receptacles with short ducts, fertilization ducts with same length as spermathecae and copulatory ducts curved (
Figs 6
G, H).
Variation . Males (n = 7 ): total length 7.3–8.7 ; carapace 3.2–3.8 ; femur I 3.6–4.1 . Females (n = 10 ): total length 8.2–10.5 ; carapace 3.4–3.8 ; femur I 2.5–3.7 .

Other material examined . BRAZIL , Tocantins : Palmas Lajeado, Usina Hidrelétrica Luis Eduardo Magalhães (
9 ° 45 ' 34 "S
;
48 ° 22 ' 15 "W
),
1 ♂
, 6 ♀,
12 .I. 2002
, D.M. Candido; M. Costa leg. ( IBSP 40369 ); Mato Grosso : Poconé (

;

),

VI. 1998

, J. Raizer et. al. leg. ( IBSP

28 .I. 2012

22 °07' 48 "S

56 ° 31 ' 12 "W
), 2 ♀,
7 .XI. 1983
, J.A. Kochalka leg. ( IBNP ). ARGENTINA , Entre Ríos : Ubajay, Parque Nacional El Palmar (
31 ° 51 ' 11 "S
;
58 ° 19 ' 21 "W
),
1 ♂
, 2 ♀,
XI. 1988
, Galiano leg. ( MACN ); Corrientes : Santiago de Alcorta ( 28 ° 78.8 ' 58.3 "S; 58 °70.0' 78.4 "W), 2 ♀,
VI. 1943
, Birabén leg. ( MACN ); Santa Fé : El Rabón (
28 ° 13 ' 17.70 ”S
;
59 ° 16 ' 4.05 ”W
), 1 ♀, Keya leg. (
MLP 15048
); Misiones : San Javier (
27 ° 52 ' 17 "S
;
55 °08' 17 "W
),
1 ♂
,
IV. 1946
, G. leg. ( MLP ).

Distribution . North, Midwest and South Brazil , Northeast Paraguay , North and Northeast Argentina (
Fig. 16
A).
